articles.headline: Incendiary N.R.A. Videos Find New Critics: N.R.A. Leaders
articles.snippet: NRATV has been a potent voice for the gun-rights group. But some leaders are questioning the streaming service’s inflammatory rhetoric, and its very purpose.
articles.abstract: NRATV has been a potent voice for the gun-rights group. But some leaders are questioning the streaming service’s inflammatory rhetoric, and its very purpose.
articles.lead_paragraph: The flash point was Thomas the Tank Engine.

articles.headline: Boeing Scrambles to Contain Fallout From Deadly Ethiopia Crash
articles.snippet: At least 20 airlines, primarily in China and Indonesia, grounded the 737 Max 8 plane, and similarities to a recent crash provoked concern among carriers, pilots, flight attendants and passengers.
articles.abstract: At least 20 airlines, primarily in China and Indonesia, grounded the 737 Max 8 plane, and similarities to a recent crash provoked concern among carriers, pilots, flight attendants and passengers.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than a dozen airlines along with the governments of China and Indonesia grounded a new version of Boeing’s most popular jet on Monday, as the American aerospace giant scrambled to deal with the fallout from a deadly plane crash in Ethiopia.
articles.byline: By David Gelles, Natalie Kitroeff and Hadra Ahmed

articles.headline: This Animal Activist Used to Get in Your Face. Now He’s Going After Your Palate.
articles.snippet: Bruce Friedrich spent decades trying to persuade people to stop eating meat. When that didn’t work, he turned his focus to creating better alternatives.
articles.abstract: Bruce Friedrich spent decades trying to persuade people to stop eating meat. When that didn’t work, he turned his focus to creating better alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Bruce Friedrich used to be the guy who broke into fashion shows to splatter fake blood on the models wearing fur coats. That was when he wasn’t handing out pamphlets on campuses or creating videos to expose the grisly reality of meat production.

articles.headline: New Brexit Defeat Plunges U.K.’s Theresa May Into Crisis
articles.snippet: Mrs. May lost a second vote on her plans to leave the European Union, and now faces unpalatable choices with time running out to avoid a chaotic exit.
articles.abstract: Mrs. May lost a second vote on her plans to leave the European Union, and now faces unpalatable choices with time running out to avoid a chaotic exit.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain hurtled into unknown political territory on Tuesday when Parliament, for the second time, rejected Prime Minister Theresa May’s plan to quit the European Union, leaving her authority in tatters and the country seemingly rudderless just 17 days before its scheduled departure from the bloc.

articles.headline: Dick’s Sporting Goods Shifts From Guns Even as Sales Suffer
articles.snippet: Edward Stack became a prominent voice for gun safety after the deadly mass shooting in Parkland, Fla., last year. That may be taking a toll on his business.
articles.abstract: Edward Stack became a prominent voice for gun safety after the deadly mass shooting in Parkland, Fla., last year. That may be taking a toll on his business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dick’s Sporting Goods, one of the largest firearms retailers in the United States, is moving further away from selling guns, even as the shift takes a toll on its earnings.

articles.headline: Actresses, Business Leaders and Other Wealthy Parents Charged in U.S. College Entry Fraud
articles.snippet: A sprawling federal investigation accuses 50 people of involvement in a scheme to get undeserving students into major American universities.
articles.abstract: A sprawling federal investigation accuses 50 people of involvement in a scheme to get undeserving students into major American universities.
articles.lead_paragraph: A teenage girl who did not play soccer magically became a star soccer recruit at Yale. Cost to her parents: $1.2 million.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Medina, Katie Benner and Kate Taylor

articles.headline: Treated Like a ‘Piece of Meat’: Female Veterans Endure Harassment at the V.A.
articles.snippet: Women say a culture of harassment, discrimination and exclusion lives inside the Veterans Affairs medical system as they try to use the government benefits they earned with military service.
articles.abstract: Women say a culture of harassment, discrimination and exclusion lives inside the Veterans Affairs medical system as they try to use the government benefits they earned with military service.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Corey Foster spent her Army career caring for wounded troops, both as a flight medic in the Iraq war and at Walter Reed hospital, so she looked forward to one of the most celebrated benefits of military service — health care for life from the Department of Veterans Affairs. Then she walked through the door at a V.A. medical center in Temple, Tex.
